spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches the 2D plan (kitchen/living left, main bedroom top-right, bath/closet core, stairs on right). However, multiple openings deviate: top-wall window configuration is not consistent with the plan, and several interior door positions/swings appear incorrect or missing. Some proportion drift is visible (bedroom and central circulation feel expanded relative to the living zone; window bay spacing on the long bottom wall does not precisely match the 2D rhythm).

structural_fidelity.notes: Primary wall network and adjacencies are mostly preserved (stairs adjacent to entry/hall; bath/closet cluster between living and bedrooms). Wall thickness is generally consistent. Fidelity drops due to interior door embedding/definition issues (some door leaves/frames are absent or represented as open portals) and incorrect/misaligned exterior window set on the top wall compared to the 2D plan.

furniture_mapping.notes: Kitchen counters and island placement broadly match (L-shaped run + island with sink). Living furniture (sofa/coffee table) and dining table are present but not tightly aligned to the 2D positions and clearances. Bedroom furniture is plausible but not a strict match to the 2D drawing arrangement.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean, readable isometric render with good lighting and generally crisp geometry. Camera is consistent with an isometric/axonometric look. Minor issues: window/door modeling simplifications reduce architectural clarity (openings not consistently framed), and some elements look slightly stylized rather than strictly orthographic-faithful.

detected_errors.description: Top (north) exterior windows in the 3D render are placed/configured differently than the 2D plan (render shows large window set(s) spanning the top wall; the plan’s top-wall openings do not match this extent/spacing).
Bottom (south) exterior window spacing/segment proportions along the long living-room wall do not precisely match the 2D plan’s window rhythm.
One or more interior doors shown in the 2D core (hall-to-bath and/or hall-to-closet/secondary room) are not clearly modeled as doors in 3D (appear as open passages or lack a door leaf/frame).
Entry door swing/orientation at the bottom-right appears inconsistent with the 2D plan’s swing direction/hinge side.
Room proportion drift: the main bedroom and central circulation/core read larger in the 3D model relative to the living/kitchen area compared to the 2D plan.
